name: Young European Research Universities Network
goal:
The Young European Research Universities Network (YERUN) consists of 17 universities of 12 EU countries.
The primary objective of YERUN is to strengthen and develop cooperation in the areas of scientific research, academic education and service to society among a cluster of highly –ranked (THE 100 under 50), young universities in Europe on an equal basis and for their common benefit.
The members of this university network have a number of key values in common:
1. an orientation towards research that makes a difference to society,
2. a commitment to internationalisation,
3. a focus on teaching quality, and
4. an emphasis on graduate employability
interests: Budget, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Environment, Food Safety, Public Health, Research and innovation, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives:
a. The European Research Area
b. Implementation of the Horizon 2020 programme.
c. Open Innovation, Open Science and Openness to the World.
d. Modernisation of Higher education
